poem:
**Disrupted Echoes**

Ring, ring,
and silence answers.  
Summer's frail  
connection missed  
the call. 

Czech coins clash  
with falling wings,  
profits plummet  
mired in static.

Lost lives hang  
on the thin wire  
of broken promises.  
This faultline  
of breath and signal,  
our failed  
modern prayer.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Business secretary expects to call in Czech billionaire’s Royal Mail takeover for review; Ryanair profits fall 46% – business live 2.55pm BST BT has been fined more than £17m for missing 14,000 emergency calls after technical faults caused the emergency call handling service to be disrupted for nearly 11 hours last summer. The telecoms regulator launched an investigation shortly after the incident on 25 June 2023. Publishing its findings on Monday, Ofcom said the handling". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
